info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Prince Edward County through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Straightstone to near Cullen to near Abilene. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Rain 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Possible flooding of low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Darlington Heights, Kingsville, Briery Creek Lake and Worsham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in Ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
